successful_downloads.title: Inhibition of IL-11 signalling extends mammalian healthspan and lifespan
successful_downloads.authors: Widjaja AA, Lim WW, Viswanathan S, et al.
successful_downloads.key_findings: Genetic deletion of Il11 extended the lives of mice by 24.9% on average. Treatment with anti-IL-11 from 75 weeks of age extends median lifespan by 22.5% in males and 25% in females.

successful_downloads.title: hs-CRP/HDL-C can predict the risk of all cause mortality in cardiovascular-kidney-metabolic syndrome stage 1-4 patients
successful_downloads.authors: Han F, Guo H, Zhang H, Zheng Y
successful_downloads.key_findings: Positive linear association between hs-CRP/HDL-C ratio and long-term mortality risk in CKM syndrome stages 1-4 patients
successful_downloads.clinical_relevance: HIGH - Risk stratification biomarker for CKM syndrome

successful_downloads.title: Serum selenium and reduced mortality in middle-aged and older adults with prefrailty or frailty: the mediating role of inflammatory status
successful_downloads.key_findings: Association between serum selenium and reduced mortality in prefrail/frail individuals, mediated by inflammatory status

successful_downloads.title: Serum sodium within the normal range and its U-shaped relationship with biological aging in U.S. adults
successful_downloads.authors: Tong X, Wang F, Liu M
successful_downloads.key_findings: U-shaped relationship between serum sodium levels (135-145 mmol/L) and biological aging in US adults
successful_downloads.clinical_relevance: MEDIUM - Optimal sodium range for healthy aging

successful_downloads.title: Extremely high HDL cholesterol paradoxically increases the risk of all-cause mortality in non-diabetic males from the Korean population
successful_downloads.authors: Ryu HE, Jung DH, Heo SJ, Park B, Lee YJ
successful_downloads.key_findings: Extremely high HDL cholesterol levels associated with increased all-cause mortality in non-diabetic males
successful_downloads.clinical_relevance: HIGH - HDL targets may need sex-specific upper limits

successful_downloads.title: Practical algorithms for early diagnosis of heart failure and heart stress using NT-proBNP: A clinical consensus statement from the Heart Failure Association of the ESC
successful_downloads.key_findings: Clinical algorithms for using NT-proBNP to diagnose heart failure and heart stress in various clinical scenarios
successful_downloads.clinical_relevance: HIGH - Clinical decision support for heart failure diagnosis

main_barriers: PubMed Central blocking direct PDF downloads (403 Forbidden)
NEJM and other major journals requiring subscriptions
Most 2024-2025 articles not available through open repositories
successfully_accessed_sources: Frontiers journals (all open access PDFs downloaded)

immediate_actions: Access PMC articles through web browser to download PDFs manually
Use institutional access if available for NEJM and AHA journals
Contact authors directly for article copies
alternative_sources: Unpaywall browser extension for finding legal open access versions
Google Scholar 'All versions' to find institutional repositories
Direct author contact via ResearchGate or email
